appeal sentence ſatisfid appeal ſay lawyer nothing elſe complaint made perſon loſt cauſe ſuperiour judg againſt injuſtice inferiour ſubordinate roman law would abide sentence obligd inſtant given appeal gave appellant writing containing summary cauſe reaſons sentence carried ſuperiour judg conſent nevertheleſs gave writing containing account whole matter reaſons would conſent admit appeal whether ſubordinate judg conſent appeal ſtill appellant might always carry suit ſuperiour judg good cuſtom tho preſent uſed france civil matter none loſt cauſe could appeal criminal cauſes man life auguſtus firſt brought way speaking faſhion suetonius relates upon occaſion certain debtor become inſolvent cùm aliquis nunquam exſoluturos ſignificare vult ad calendas graecas ſoluturos ait inſtead name calends geeeks made uſe word 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 e day new moon ſame thing calends among roman paſſage plutarch life galba plainly prof 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 calends january conſiderable calends month becauſe particularly conſecrated juno god janus upon account roman never faild offer vow sacrifice theſe two deity people clad new gown went crouds tarpeian mount janus altar although calends january feſtival day yet fail begin new work every man according profeſſion might never idle reſt year begun working magiſtrates entered upon office day feaſts kept everywhere preſents exchangd token friendſhip feaſts calends ſays matthew balaſtris kept firſt day january great rejoycing becauſe new moon happend day commonly believd diverted themſelves well beginning ſhould paſs whole year merrily day brought sorrow debtor obligd pay intereſt arrears upon account horace call triſtes calendas calendarium calendar almanack contains order day week month ſhews feſtivals happen year roman people firſt calendar hand prieſts learned feſtivals solemnity civil life took great care write every thing happened year marked moreover day pleading none therefore calendar called faſtus plural number faſti alſo annales publici becauſe ſet moſt conſiderable action great men commonwealth hence come theſe ordinary form speech conſcribere nomina faſtis referre faſtos annales publicos e tranſmit memory poſterity cn flavius secretary appius clandius gave people calendar deſpite prieſts senate romulus firſt divided time certain mark ſerve uſe people ſubject much ſkilful military affair aſtronomy made year commence spring gave ten month whereof firſt month march next april may june quintilis sextilis september october november december gave 31 day theſe four month march may quintilis committed day alſo hour day care ſome planet ti likely day called name planet direction firſt hour wherefore saturday day saturn thus called becauſe firſt hour day direction saturn following hour came ſucceſſively power following planet ſecond hour jupiter immediately followed saturn third mar fourth sun fifth venus ſixth mercury ſeventh moon afterwards eighth hour returnd power saturn according ſame order ſame planet saturn ſtill fifteenth two twentieth hour direction conſequence three twentieth hour command jupiter four twentieth viz laſt hour day found direction mar firſt hour following day came dominion sun conſequently gave name ſecond day following always ſame order eighth fifteenth two twentieth hour always belong sun twenty third venus laſt mercury wherefore firſt hour third day appertained moon called reaſon day moon alſo referrd eighth fifteenth two twentieth hour ſame day therefore twenty third hour aſcribed saturn moon muſt return saturn laſt jupiter whence firſt hour fourth day found direction mar gave alſo name day alſo eighth fifteenth two twentieth conſequently twenty third hour belonged sun twenty fourth venus firſt fifteenth day mercury ſo forth following ſame order whereby ſee origine neceſſary ſeries name given day week reaſon day sun come day saturn viz sunday saturday day moon day sun monday sunday day mar day moon tueſday monday wedneſday tueſday thurſday friday laſt saturday ſo reſt ſtill another ingenious reaſon might given theſe denomination day name planet given day week follow one another proportion muſical harmony called greek 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 origne principle good harmony antients nature whereof conſiſts betwixt two tone four voice three interval ſounds different one another wherefore always two ſilent tone betwixt ti likely ancient leave u ſome idea admirable muſick diſpoſed day week follow one another according muſical harmony wherefore planet come immediately another leaf two others behind ſilent viz saturn come sun leaving jupiter mar sun follows moon overrunning venus mercury moon appears mar mar mercury without mentioning either sun venus mercury jupiter without reckoning either moon saturn next jupiter venus freed heir benefit law without act acceptation admitted refuſe contrary bound pay debt even eſtate good purchasd ſince obtaind freedom unleſs praetor granted benefit ſeparation child deceaſed perſons authority time death like slave neceſſity accepting inheritance neceſſary heir parent death father inheritance rather continuation patrimony new purchaſe third kind heir called stranger neither slave child dead perſon free accept quit inheritance performed deed law text roman law three ſeveral way purchaſing accepting inheritance viz aditio hereditatis ſolemn deed performed magiſtrate geſtio pro herede deed owner fell eſtates receive rent debt gather fruit manner accepting inheritance ſeverally expreſsd roman law perſon ſtrange heir ti called geſtio pro herede perſon child ti called immixtio third way ſingle plain accepting refuſing alſo three contrary way quit inheritance viz repudiatio deed law performed preſence magiſtrate abſtentio child laſt ſingle man declared unwilling heir four twenty part five hundred year unknown roman till firſt punick war reckond day riſing ſetting sun added noon fine found diviſion civil day four twenty hour however two kind hour ſome equal others unequal equal hour thoſe always ſame ſtate hour make uſe making twenty fourth part natural day number four twenty whereof twelve day twelve night unequal hour longer summer ſhorter winter regard day contrary night ſpeak unequal hour one muſt think one theſe hour longer reſpect ſeveral seaſons thoſe summer longer thoſe winter regard day night thoſe winter longer thoſe summer dividing way artificial day twelve equal part ſixth hour fall noon third middle foregoing time riſing sun noon ninth hour middle following time noon sunſetting thus others roman divided hour day four viz prima tertia sexta nona prima began ſix clock tertia nine sexta twelve nona three clock afternoon wherefore canonical hour called prima tertia sexta nona usd church honour ſacred myſteries performd theſe hour likewiſe roman divided twelve hour night four watch calld vigiliae latin word taken military diſcipline wherefore pliny call castreaſes vegetius tell u four vigiliae night watch three hour poſſible ſays soldier ſhould keep centry whole night wherefore divided four vigiliae theſe vigiliae relievd centries ſet freſh one room muſt conſider roman reckond hour prima began ſix clock comprehended three hour one askd reckond ſeventh eighth hour anſwer diſtinguiſhd amongſt themſelves peculiar name viz prima ſecunda tertia quarta quinta ſexta ſeptima octava nona decima martial tell u extructos frangere nona toros hora libellorum decima eſt eupheme meorum temperat ambroſias cùm tua cura dapes twelve hour day equinox ſet according order firſt hour day ſix ſeven ſecond ſeven eight third called tertia happend nine clock theſe word inquintam extendit comprehended fourth fifth hour viz eleven clock morning sexta befel always noon ſeventh hour noon one clock eighth one two ninth river jordan running two lake loſes ſelf third large sea bad taſte peſtiferous ſmell water agitated wind neither river bird fiſhes endure whatſoever caſt float men cant ſwim never ſink water however man know cauſe wonder certain time caſts forth bitumen experience taught men gather like thing ti black liquor congeald vinegar float water manner loading ship draw ſides ship juſt deck ſo follow ſucceſſively run interrupted hole ti thus reported ancient inhabitant country aſſure u bitumen gathered heap either driven wind drawn ſhore dried heat sun exhalation earth thus grown hard ti cut like ſtone wood near lake thoſe fruitful well peopled plain city sodom gomorrha conſumed fire ti ſaid mark wrath heaven remains ſtill earth burnt ſtrength produce thing grows planted either bearing bloſſom fruit grows black turned aſhes causd according opinion corruption air earth occaſioned neighbouring lake notwithſtanding deny fire heaven might deſtroyed whole city river belus diſembogues itſelf sea judaea mouth take sand make glaſs mixing niter tho river ſmall one yet never exhauſted country many village city whereof jeruſalem chiefeſt encompaſsd three wall firſt incloſes city ſecond palace third temple ſtately building might ſerve cittadel jew allowed go gate thereof prieſts permitted go people always deſpiſed nation firſt aſſyrians medes perſians macedonian antiochus attempted vain rhea daughter caelus siſter saturn titan rhea divorced ſhe married saturn induced make war againſt ammon vanquiſhed forced make eſcape sea retired crete poſſeſſed himſelf kingdom ſame author tell u aſſociated bacchus alſo undertaking alexander prince acquainted arabian honoured two divinity jupiter bacchus reſolved ſubdue might god amongſt poet tell u jupiter married ſeveral wife even juno siſter according aſſyrian perſian faſhion fruitful lover begat great many child legitimate natural turning himſelf ſometimes bull ſometimes swan eagle gold enjoy amour wherefore lucian introduces momus rallying thus fine metamorphoſes made ſometimes affraid left ſhould brought shamble put plough thou wert bull goldſmith ſhould melt thee thou wert gold swan leſt ſhould put thee upon spit roaſted thee ti alſo reported brought forth minerva brain vulcan opened axe lucian relates dialogue god vulcan jupiter ſpeak thus vulcan ſharp axe bring jup prythee ſtrike hard cleave head aſunder vul mind ſee whether mad warrant tell good earneſt imploy jup divide skull ſay jeſt refuſe plague strike thy might head ready ſplit pain ſuffer ſuch torment labour child vul ti againſt muſt obey great god wonder headach ſo great ſuch amazon sphear shield lodged ti ſtill recorded bacchus came thigh lodged perfect time taken mother semeles womb yet half formd wherefore inciſion made thigh pain labour ſeizd give free paſſage little bacchus yet reported ſame lucian dialogue god nation world built great many temple honoured like god ſeveral name according ſeveral performance called jupiter inventor soveraign authority child confine ſell put death diſpoſe way ſhould think fit xv ut si qua peccasset mulier poenam lueret ex mariti arbitrio si veneficij circa prolem vel adulterii esset accusata mulierem repudiasset rerum ejus par uxori daretur par autem cereri cederet wife found faulty husband puniſhed according pleaſure ſhe poyſoned child committed adultery husband kindred inquired fact ſhe found guilty inflicted puniſhments pleaſed upon ſhe drunk wine ſhe puniſhed like adultereſs husband put away wife cauſe beſides poyſoning adultery part wealth given wife part cere roman matron forbidden drink wine husband power kill drunk pliny aſſures l 14 c 13 non licebat vinum romani feminis bibere invenemus inter exempla egnatii mecennii uxorem quod vinum bibiſſet edolio interfectam fuiſſe marito eumque caedis romulo abſolutum cato ideo propinquos feminis oſculum dare inſtituit ut ſcirent antemetum olerent hoc tum nomen vina erat wherefore cato ordered married woman ſhould kiſs relation know ſmelt wine xvi ut omnes parricidae capite plecterentur parricide ſhould puniſhed death following law made numa ſecond king roman pisces quei ſquamoſei non ſunt nei polluceto ſquamoſos omnes praeter scarum polluceto offer ſacrifice god fiſhes without ſcales thoſe ſcaly except scarum sarpta vinea nei ſiet ex ea vinum diis libarier nefas eſtod ti lawful offer god wine growth vine never pruned feſtus explaining word sarpta ſays sarpta vinea putata e pura facta sarpere enim antiqui pro purgare ponebant god accepted sacrifice thoſe pure ancient offered pure wine god uttering fit moſt often teſtators thus diſpoſed wealth private legacy executor ſeeing remained nothing quitted mean whole made void legatee got nothing wherefore prevent premunire law called falcidia made enacted teſtators ſhould power diſpoſe laſt three fourth part wealth ſhould bound leave fourth part heir appointed therefore law called quarta falcidia falcidia made little time empire auguſtus triumvirat filii filiaeque familias bonorum paternorum ſui ſuaeque heredes ſunto law twelve table inſtituted two kind heir inheritor abiuteſtat e without making viz ſuorum agnatorum child kindred male line ſo much regarded ancient roman law female ſo neglected child inherit good mother mother heir childrens eſtate afterwards decree senate made ſetting mutual succeſſion viz orficianum jus impowering child inherit mother tertyllianum jus ſettling right mother inheritance child sei qua molier poſt virei mortem decem proximeis menſebos pariat quei quave ex eâ naſcatur ſouus ſuave virei familia here eſtod woman delivered child ten month death husband let child born either boy girl heir father ulpians opinion child born eleven month death father able inherit poſt decem menſes mortis natus non admittitur ad legitimain hereditatem however emperor adrian declared honeſt woman lying eleventh month death husband child born might lawfully inherit father eſtate grounded therein upon authority phyſicians philoſophers wherefore varro ſays satyr intitled teſtamentum si quis undecimo menſe 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 natus eſto here whereupon cujacius tell u muſt underſtood eleventh month began conjugal affection afterwards obſerved roman empire time paganiſm ancient oeconomy alſo firſt chriſtian emperor continued even reign juſtinian ſo certain looked upon ſo reaſonable party concerned ch ph pſ put practiſe reign according teſtimony gregory tour sixteen conſonants remain four called liquid fluent one viz l r n tho ſtrictly ſpeaking l r deſerve name two eſpecially little liquid ten may called mute may divided three claſſeles according affinity one another mute b p f v c q g two make claſs ſelf unleſs two double one x z joined thereunto becauſe make principal part h ti aſpiration month space time sun take run one sign zodiac make 12th part year cicero derives word menſura metior qui quia menſa ſpatia conficiunt menſes nominantur month properly ſpeaking time either moon take run thro zodiac called aſtrologers periodical month return sun sun diſtinguiſhd name synodical month yet name alſo given time sun running twelfth part zodiac two sort month viz lunar solar hereby diſtinguiſhed lunar synodical month alone people mind little twenty nine day half solar uſually accounted conſiſt ſome thirty day ten hour half month diſtinguiſhed aſtronomical civil month firſt properly solar month civil accommodated cuſtoms people particular nation every one way ſome uſing lunar others solar month jew greek roman formerly made uſe lunar month avoid ſuch fraction number would happen made alternatively conſiſt twenty nine thirty day calling former cavi pleni egyptian uſed solar month ordered conſiſt thirty day adding end year five day made supernumerary hour neglecting six hour thereabouts aroſe half hour made seaſons revolution every four year go backward one day make uſe theſe month tho render unequal ſame time reſerve six hour make day four year four year explained word annus may ſeen purpoſe romulus made year firſt conſiſt ten month firſt march april may june quintilis july sextilis auguſt september october november december numa pompiltus particular converſe pythagoras learned diver thing aſtronomical art made good uſe eſpecially upon occaſion added two month romulus ten month taking day april june auguſt september december romulus allowed thirty day leaving thirty one day reſt adding thoſe six day fifty one wanting romulus year conſiſted 304 day order perfect 355 made 57 day divided two month viz january 29 day february 28 placed march concerned day laſt month conſiſted even number becauſe deſigned time offer sacrifice infernal god number unhappy according egyptian superſtition ſeemed belong conſtituted month january appointed wintersolſtice firſt month year inſtead march ſo romulus put vernal equinox roman made uſe three word reckon day month wit calends none ides firſt day every month called calends four following day none except march may july october 6 day none came ides contained eight day reſt month reckoned calends following month make uſe roman month reckon day therein 1 2 3 4 c see ſaid upon aſtrology rhetorick polyhymnia diodorus ſays afterwards word muſe come 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſignifies teach hidden thing ſuch capacity vulgar give reaſon ſeveral name given nine muſes manifeſt theſe name greek relation nature agreeableneſs muſick poetry much inclined men believe ſame purely greek invention ti moral genealogy like unto ſometimes make vertues vice name mother memory alſo proof hereof however ſame hiſtorian put mnemoſyne among titanes make nine muſes accompany oſiris military expedition give account theology egyptian riſûs amator erat oſiris muſicâ choreiſque gaudebat ideò muſicorum agmen circumducebat quo novem erant virgines canendi ſcientiâ praeſtantes c eruditae graci muſas vocant quarum praeſes apollo undè muſagetes dictus thus ſee origin muſes greece laid egypt given poet repreſent muſes unto u beautiful young adorned garland flower made reſidence mount parnaſſus helicon apollo conſecrated ſeveral fountain called hippoerene fountain horſe pegaſus among tree palm lawrel musca fly poet feigned inſect formerly female muſician moon rival reſpect amour endymion becauſe ſhe came often ſing play aſleep jealous moon changed fly hence ſhe always infeſts ſuch aſleep eſpecially young people hatred love get ſome kiſſes ſmart little thoſe paſſionate lover formerly lady name made good verſes courtizan athens reproached pricked lover till blood ran lucian writ little treatiſe praiſe fly inſerted place fly ſays reſpect inſects ſo big ſhe little compariſon bee may ſaid delicateneſs wing ſhe much excel bird lawful reckon number silk common thread wool wing covered feather fine crape like graſhoppers look upon sun ſhe ſhines many colour like peacock tail pigeon neck ſhe flie moving wing bird ſudden motion rebound like locuſts yet ſo flexible turn inſtant noiſe ſhe make flight ſo harſh waſps like muſick flute compared hautboy trumpet ſhe large eye flower upon head hard ſhining made horn head fixed body ſuch manner graſhoppers ſhe hold mean neck ſtirs way body heap leg long ſhort like thoſe waſps belly covered ſhining lame like unto antique cuiraſs ſhe prick sting bee little trunk ſerves inſtead mouth kind tooth end wherewith ſhe bite ſucks blood milk without much harm fine leg whereof two fore one ſerve inſtead hand ſhe clean ſelf conveys food mouth man accompanies man life time taſtes every thing eats except oil deadly poiſon life long pleaſant ti little dexterity ſerveher avoid web spider every lay ambuſcades boldneſs ſometimes doth precipitate homer compare moſt valiant hero cannot bear praiſe magnifie similies uſes ſeveral part poem sometimes deſcribes flight ſhe go company towards ſome veſſel full milk ſome ſpilt blood sacrifice another make uſe example ſpeaks diligence vigilancy wherewith minerva defended menelaus another place call gentle good becauſe ſhe sting wound dangerous thoſe waſps bee shall ſpeak power ſo great men cannot defend themſelves love free heavenly ſhe fly air coupled male ti alſo ſaid ſhe sex netoni yet ſo fat tho otherwiſe mien delicacy woman ſhaved every day wore peruke becauſe little hair peruke may diſtinctly obſerved silver gold medal twas brought uſe wig italy braſs medal prince egyptian syrian repreſent peruke perhaps becauſe know uſe thereof thoſe country ſo give ſo exact reſemblance latin one ſtamped italy inclimations conformable thoſe nero conformity made contract ſo entire friendſhip every thing common even wife without entertaining leaſt jealouſie thereupon however otho became emperor appeared better diſpoſition perhaps put conſtraint upon himſelf might procure patritian order entruſted care thoſe buckler laid mar temple carried yearly dancing capering thro city feaſt mar prieſthood auguſt rome officiated chief perſons empire aſſumed number twelve read hiſtory ſeveral great captain among roman made themſelves order salii ſuch appius claudius emperor titus antoninus scipio africanus livy ſays left army becauſe order salii feſtival day drew near reaſon army continued ſome time incamped helieſpont till return scipio ſtaied ſome place order perform devotion day ſaid feaſt stativa deinde ad helieſpontum aliquandiu habuerunt quia dy fortè quibus ancylia moventur religioſi ad iter inciderant iidem dy p scipionem propiore etiam religione quia salius erat disjunxerant ab exercitu cauſaque ipſe morae erat dum conſequeretur salian called collini alſo number twelve inſtituted tullius hoſtilius patrician order ſaid king fighting againſt fidenates livy ſays finding worſt made vow mar would increaſe number salii victory ſo done created twelve salian salinae salthouſes pliny ſays ancus martius firſt erected salthouſes near oſtia towards tiber mouth rex ancus salina primus inſtituit granary salt rome ſtood near gate called trigemina saltatio dance lucian dialogue concerning dancing ſays ti ancient world took original love witneſs add various motion star different conjunction thoſe fixed wandring body ti motion heaven harmony divine art took origin improved time ſaid rhea firſt took delight exerciſe ſhe taught prieſts creet phrygia invention uſeleſs leaping dancing ſaved jupiter life father intended devour inſomuch king heaven owed safety dancing thoſe time military exerciſe conſiſted ſtriking sword javelin upon shield pyrrhus invented pyrrhica dance performed arm lacedaemonians learnt art caſtor pollux improved care never went war without dancing flute inſomuch may ſaid owed part glory dancing youth accuſtomed themſelves much exerciſe dancing arm player upon flute fixing himſelf midſt began motion piping dancing followed making thouſand warlike poſtures good order ſame thing practiſed dance called hormus mixture compoſed boy girl wherein boy lead dance manly warlike poſtures girl followed gentler modeſt pace deſign compoſe harmony strength moderation alſo another dance performed barefoot ſay nothing homer repreſents achilles shield wherein daedalus inſtructed fair ariadne caperers great dancer went cut dangerous caper theſſalians eſteemed ſo much chief magiſtrates borrowed name called themſelves proorqueſtres thoſe lead dance inſcription met statue well honour ſuch one danced well fight valliant battel offered sacrifice delos without dance young boy chief whereof lead dance sound flute harp need ſpeak greek ſince indian themſelves worſhip sun kiſſing hand dancing thereby meant imitate motion admirable planet divine worſhip ſince ſame performed sunſetting riſing ethiopian went dancing battle let fly arrow ſet order head form sunbeam leaped danced terrifie enemy let u go egypt story proteus repreſents excellent dancer making thouſand different poſtures ſupple body ingenuity mind knew counterfeit imitate every thing three sort nobleſt dance cordaciſmus syncinnis emmaelia took name satyr fidius ovid informs u theſe name meant one thing god peculiar sabine communicated roman quaerebam nonas sancto fidione referrem tibi semo pater tunc mihi sanctus ait cuicumque ex iſtis dederis ego born saturn according poet father king golden age age bliſs wherein adam lived delight terreſtrial paradice name saturn agrees admirably well firſt man sin went hide himſelf daring appear god satar hebrew ſignifies bide one ſelf whence alſo ti poet made saturn paſs italy gave name latium country landed reigned according relation ſo saturnalia tellus latium ſame country theſe two name bearing ſame signification tho one hebrew latin poet make saturn son heaven earth ſo adam formed earth god heaven made empire saturn golden age ended together saturn applied himſelf agriculture adam alſo ſinned driven terreſtrial paradice king reduced condition labourer laſtly prophane author well hiſtorians poet recorded men lived free reign saturn without mention yet made amongſt vaſſalage servitude earth aſide always uſed make model whether went make statue marble caſt mettal never undertook theſe laborious work firſt made model earth without doubt gave praxiteles occaſion ſay art making earthen figure mother brought forth art making marble braſs figure began appear perfection till 300 year building rome phidias athens lived time excelled thoſe went either working marble ivory mettals quickly came great number excellent artiſts advanced sculpture higheſt pitch arrived sicyone appeard polycletus whoſe figure admired world model thoſe ſtudied art afterwards myron came inimitable lyſippus author writ concerning work loſt ſhould remained ignorant chief ceremony thereof zozimus lived towards end fourth century taken care give u abridged account thereof ſecond book hiſtory ſays thereupon find confirmed explained ſome medal thoſe secular play ſtill eſpecially thoſe domitian original therefore ſaid play take follows city rome afflicted great plague ſame year wherein expelled tarquin valerius publicola conſul order appeaſe wrath god ordered celebrate solemnity ceremony whereof found oracle sibylls kept great care twas year foundation rome 245 according calculation varro beſt moſt followed 509 year saviour nativity theſe play called secular becauſe obliged renew age age every 100 year according moſt received opinion every 110 year 15 officer called quindecimviri pretended auguſtus time rome look ceremony religion ſaid excuſe found way clear themſelves emperor accuſed celebrated ſaid play time appointed may ſee father taſſin jeſuites treatiſe concerning secular play auguſtus celebrated conſulſhip furnius silanus year rome 737 emperor claudius would renew anno 800 becauſe beginning century domitian without reſpect claudius conformed himſelf auguſtus done celebrated 103 year prince done year rome 840 time publiſhed empire according ancient cuſtom every one might come ſee thoſe play never ſeen never ſhould opened thoſe game thus towards beginning harveſt emperor ſovereign pontiff haranged people capitol exhorted prepare themſelves ſo ſolemn feaſt purifying body mind like exhortation made great feaſts particularly myſteries cere eleuſina whoſe ceremony like thoſe secular play herodian obſerves emperor ſeated tribunal temple jupiter capitolinus gave ſome perfume diſtributed people theſe perfume conſiſted sulphur bitumen quindecimviri received emperor afterwards diſtributed among people adding thereunto little piece firwood called taeda theylighted one end threw ſome ſaid perfume upon smoak whereof every one cauſed go round order purifie himſelf alſo gave ſame child year underſtanding day whereon theſe play celebrated come began proceſſion whereat prieſts college aſſiſted senate magiſtrates preſent people clad white crowned sicilian sea aeolus according varro king whence feigned wind dominion becauſe foretold storm ſhould happen obſerving vapour steam aroſe thoſe iſlands eſpecially called vulcan name ʋt varro dixit rex fuit infularum ex quarum nebulis fumo vulcaniae inſulae praedicens ventura flabra ventorum ab imperitis viſus eſt ventos ſuâ poteſtate retinere pliny ſays strongylus one thoſe burnt ſmoaking iſlands inhabitant fume thereof predicted wind ſhould follow three day reaſon feigned aeolus maſter wind e cujus fumo quinam flaturi ſint venti triduum praedicere incolae traduntur unde ventos aeolo paruiſſe exiſtimatum nevertheleſs ti certain worſhipping wind ancienter aeolus reign pretend lived time trojan war perſians according strabo herodotus worſhipped wind never heard king theſe little iſlands twas addreſt worſhip much may ſaid reſpect scythian lucian toxaris ſays ſwore wind sword per ventum acinacem solomon proverb ſays men ſo mad adore wind little thought aeolus matter thoſe eaſtern idolater worſhipped wind fable aeolus invented ſo reaſon believe worſhipping wind well part nature paſſed eaſt weſt ſo grecian sicilian italian took occaſion nature thoſe iſlands make kingdom wind becauſe often found whirlwind vapour wind fire proceed thence strabo relates unto u obſervations polybius upon iſle lipara greateſt aeolus seven iſlands viz south wind blew covered ſo thick cloud thoſe little
